# sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(_:_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

-  sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(_:_:) 

Function# sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(_:_:)

iOS 12.0+iPadOS 12.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.14+tvOS 12.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 5.0+

```
func sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(
    _ options: sec_protocol_options_t,
    _ is_fallback_attempt: Bool
)
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/Security/sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(_:_:)#parameters)

`options`A `sec_protocol_options_t` instance.

`is_fallback_attempt`Set a flag indicating that this is a TLS fallback attempt.

## [Discussion](/documentation/Security/sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(_:_:)#discussion)

Signal if this is a TLS fallback attempt.



```
 A fallback attempt is one following a previously failed TLS connection
 due to version or parameter incompatibility, e.g., when speaking to a server
 that does not support a client-offered ciphersuite.


 Clients MUST NOT enable fallback for fresh connections.

```
title: sec_protocol_options_set_tls_is_fallback_attempt(_:_:) | Apple Developer Documentation
